character_name: James Bond (007): An MI6 agent who is sent to investigate Auric Goldfinger. Connery reprised the role of Bond for the third time in a row. His salary rose

Pussy Galore: Goldfinger's personal pilot and leader of an all-female team of pilots known as Pussy Galore's Flying Circus. Blackman was selected for the role of Pussy Galore because of her role in The Avengers[6] and the script was rewritten to show Blackman's judo abilities.[7] The character's name follows in the tradition of other Bond girls names that are double entendres. Concerned about censors
Jill Masterson: Bond Girl and Goldfinger's aide-de-camp
Tilly Masterson: The sister of Jill Masterson
Oddjob: Goldfinger's lethal Korean manservant. Director Guy Hamilton cast Sakata
M: 007's boss and head of the British Secret Service.
Mr Solo: The lone gangster who refuses to take part in Operation Grand Slam and is later killed by Oddjob.

Felix Leiter: Bond's CIA liaison in the United States. Linder was the only actor actually on location in Miami.[18] Linder's interpretation of Leiter was that of a somewhat older man than the way the character was played by Jack Lord in Dr. No; in reality
Mr Simmons: Goldfinger's gullible gin rummy opponent in Miami.

Mr Midnight: The gangster whose contributions Goldfinger says helped smuggle the nerve gas across the Canadian border. He initially complains that New York and West Coast mafiosi were also participating
Kisch: Goldfinger's secondary and quiet henchman and loyal lieutenant who leads his boss's false Army convoy to Fort Knox.
Bonita: dancer who sets a trap for Bond in the pre-credit sequence.
Colonel Smithers: the Bank of England official.
Mr Ling: A Communist Chinese nuclear fission specialist who provides Goldfinger with the dirty bomb to irradiate the gold inside Fort Knox.
Dink: Bond's masseuse from the Miami hotel sequence. Nolan also appeared as the gold-covered body in advertisements for the film[8] and in the opening title sequence as the golden silhouette
